title: The Noctuary: or an Address from the Tombs, a Poem, in Blank Verse. To which is added, an ode on the Last Day
A rencounter at a Mask-Ball, between a Princess of the Blood in France and a handsome lawyer's clerk. [In verse.]
The Plagues of the Spleen: an heroic poem. With an appendix, entitled The Humourist, or, the Absent Man. By the inimitable author of Telemachus [i.e. Fénelon.]
first_author: SALIGNAC DE LA MOTHE FÉNELON, François de Archbishop of Cambray, pseud
